TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit BezierCurve extends System.ValueType

Docs.summary: Represents a bezier curve with as many points as you want.

Docs.summary: Calculates the length of this bezier curve.
Docs.remarks: The precision gets better as the value gets smaller.

MemberSignature.Value: public static float CalculateLength (System.Collections.Generic.IList<OpenTK.Vector2> points, float precision);
.method public static hidebysig float32 CalculateLength(class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<valuetype OpenTK.Vector2> points, float32 precision) cil managed

Docs.summary: Calculates the length of the specified bezier curve.
Docs.returns: The precision gets better as the value gets smaller.

MemberSignature.Value: public static float CalculateLength (System.Collections.Generic.IList<OpenTK.Vector2> points, float precision, float parallel);
.method public static hidebysig float32 CalculateLength(class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<valuetype OpenTK.Vector2> points, float32 precision, float32 parallel) cil managed

Docs.summary: Calculates the length of the specified bezier curve.

remarks.para: The precision gets better as the value gets smaller.

The parameter defines whether the curve should be calculated as a parallel curve to the original bezier curve. A value of 0.0f represents the original curve, 5.0f represents a curve that has always a distance of 5.0f to the orignal curve.

Docs.summary: Calculates the point with the specified t.

Docs.param: The t parameter, a value between 0.0f and 1.0f.
Docs.summary: Calculates the point on the given bezier curve with the specified t parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: public static OpenTK.Vector2 CalculatePoint (System.Collections.Generic.IList<OpenTK.Vector2> points, float t, float parallel);

Docs.param: The t parameter, a value between 0.0f and 1.0f.
Docs.summary: Calculates the point on the given bezier curve with the specified t parameter.
Docs.remarks: The parameter defines whether the curve should be calculated as a parallel curve to the original bezier curve. A value of 0.0f represents the original curve, 5.0f represents a curve that has always a distance of 5.0f to the orignal curve.

MemberSignature.Value: public float Parallel;
.field public float32 Parallel

Docs.remarks: This value defines whether the curve should be calculated as a parallel curve to the original bezier curve. A value of 0.0f represents the original curve, 5.0f i.e. stands for a curve that has always a distance of 5.0f to the orignal curve at any point.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Collections.Generic.IList<OpenTK.Vector2> Points { get; }
.property instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<valuetype OpenTK.Vector2> Points

Docs.summary: Gets the points of this curve.
Docs.remarks: The first point and the last points represent the anchor points.
